full_threads.body:
@heath  @ricaV2

 

I can't update this site's plugin because the theme needs a registration required in order to update some of the plugins.  The theme plugin also belongs to level 3 since it needs help from Heath or Joel to resolve it.

Thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Manuel Lito Manceli

full_threads.body:
This message was sent to the following 6 people: WP Perk Support Team, Joel Maligalig, Glen Jose Tenorio, Jaime Velasquez, Manuel Manceli, Rica V. Replying to this email will notify them.

Hello,

While we did not hear from you, I can see that some progress has been done over the updates, but there are still 3 plugins that need to be updated:

+----------------+--------+-----------+---------+

| name | status | update | version |

+----------------+--------+-----------+---------+

| fusion-builder | active | available | 3.4.1 |

| fusion-core | active | available | 5.4.1 |

| LayerSlider | active | available | 6.9.2 |

+----------------+--------+-----------+---------+

Can you please make sure those are updated as well in order to avoid the security guarantee being voided? Looking forward to your reply.
Bogdan from Kinsta
On Tue, Aug 16, 2022 at 04:44 PM, "Bogdan Stratulat" <bogdan.stratulat@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi WP,

This is our final reminder before we're canceling Security Pledge on your site, which makes you liable for a $100 cleanup fee.﻿

I am following up on the malware removal performed on your website staging-cruiseworldholidays.kinsta.cloud on August 11, 2022. After each cleanup we perform on websites, we require customers to update all website software within 24 hours after the cleanup to prevent reinfection and patch any software-based vulnerability. Unfortunately, I see that you still have outdated software on your website, please see the summary below:

277) : eval()'d code on line 95
+-----------------------------------+----------+-----------+---------+
| name | status | update | version |
+-----------------------------------+----------+-----------+---------+

| autoptimize | active | available | 3.0.4 |
| broken-link-checker | inactive | available | 1.11.16 |

| official-facebook-pixel | active | available | 3.0.6 |
| fusion-builder | inactive | available | 2.2.3 |
| fusion-core | active | available | 4.2.3 |

| imagify | active | available | 1.10 |
| LayerSlider | active | available | 6.9.2 |
| worker | active | available | 4.9.9 |
| redirection | active | available | 5.2.3 |
| instagram-feed | active | available | 6.0.5 |
| wp-mail-smtp | inactive | available | 3.4.0 |
+-----------------------------------+----------+-----------+---------+

I urge you to process the updates to prevent the cancellation of the guarantee, so we can keep offering our free malware removals for this site.
﻿

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter, we look forward to your feedback.

Bogdan | Malware & Abuse Engineer

Kinsta

On Thu, Aug 11, 2022 at 05:02 PM, "Farhan Faisal" <farhan.faisal@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi ,

Our monitoring systems have detected malware on your site staging-cruiseworldholidays.kinsta.cloud. As part of our security guarantee, we've completed the repair of the infected site.

/wp-includes/wp-system-cloud.php
/wp-admin/images/images.php
/wp-content/plugins/core-engine/index.php
/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/includes/settings/settings.php
/wp-content/plugins/wp-lazyload-fCDHsXDwtfT154Pb-module/wp-lazyload.php
/wp-content/plugins/wp-lazyload-SuxTl2wcaM22uICb-module/wp-lazyload.php
/wp-content/plugins/wp-lazyload-yeklFwZ4op79oRg2-module/wp-lazyload.php
/wp-content/themes/Avada/includes/lib/inc/fusion-app/assets/js/select2/framework.php
/wp-includes/class-handler-block-widgets.php
/wp-includes/class-wordpress-license.php
Along with 2322 javascript files injected with malicious redirects.

Below you will see a list of all WordPress users with administrator access to the site. Please review this list carefully and then log into your site and delete any administrators that are no longer needed or that you do not recognize:

| 4  | CruiseWorldHolidays | info@cruiseworldholidays.com.au   | 2011-09-25 08:26:25 |
| 2  | Janelle.Ramsay      | janelle.revesby@helloworld.com.au | 2009-07-02 10:40:17 |
| 7  | wpperk-support      | support@wpperk.com                | 2020-02-20 05:15:41 |

As a preventative measure, we have updated the WordPress salts in the wp-config.php file and forced password reset on all admins. This will have the effect of causing all users to be logged out of the site, meaning users will have to log in the next time they access the site.

We have installed password-evolved and simple-history plugin to monitor user activities and enforce strong password on your users. You can delete them anytime if you think this is unnecessary, but do allow some time so that you can get some insight of whats happening on your site.

In addition, please note that the SFTP/SSH and database passwords have been changed. The next time you use SFTP/SSH or access phpMyAdmin you will need to use the updated passwords.

We would ask that you take the following steps within the next 24 hours:

  1. Install any available updates to the WordPress core and the site's themes and plugins.
  2. Require all administrators to change their WordPress passwords.

Known vulnerabilities in older versions of plugins, themes, and the WordPress core are common points of entry for malicious activity. As a result, it is our policy that any site that has been infected with malware must have the WordPress core, as well as all plugins and themes updated to the latest version within 24 hours of repair.

Below is a list of outdated software currently on the site. Please ensure that these updates are applied within 24 hours, failing to do so will make the site no longer be eligible for free malware cleanups per our Security Guarantee.

Outdated plugins

| akismet                           | active   | available | 4.2.4   |
| autoptimize                       | active   | available | 3.0.4   |
| broken-link-checker               | inactive | available | 1.11.16 |
| cms-tree-page-view                | active   | available | 1.6.4   |
| official-facebook-pixel           | active   | available | 3.0.6   |
| fusion-builder                    | inactive | available | 2.2.3   |
| fusion-core                       | active   | available | 4.2.3   |
| google-analytics-dashboard-for-wp | inactive | available | 6.8.0   |
| gravityforms                      | active   | available | 2.6.3   |
| imagify                           | active   | available | 1.10    |
| LayerSlider                       | active   | available | 6.9.2   |
| redirection                       | active   | available | 5.2.3   |
| instagram-feed                    | active   | available | 6.0.5   |
| wp-mail-smtp                      | inactive | available | 3.4.0   |

WordPress core version : 5.8.4
Latest version : 6.0.1

Please notify us as soon as updates have been applied so that we can update our records to reflect that all updates have been applied.

Finally, please note that we have disabled the theme and plugin editors in the WordPress admin area. While we recommend leaving these disabled permanently, if you do use them you can reenable them after all users have updated their passwords by removing these lines from your site's wp-config.php file:

##Disable Editing in Dashboard
﻿define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out.
﻿
﻿Regards,


﻿Farhan Faisal | Malware & Abuse Engineer

Kinsta
